Package com.ezasm.simulation

Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
com.ezasm.simulation.Simulator
public class Simulator extends Object
The main controller class. Manages the memory, registers, and lines.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor
    Description

    Constructs a Simulator with the default specifications.

    Constructs a Simulator with the given word size and memory size specifications.

    • Simulator

      public Simulator()
      Constructs a Simulator with the default specifications.

    • Simulator

      public Simulator(int wordSize, int memorySize)
      Constructs a Simulator with the given word size and memory size specifications.
      Parameters:
      wordSize - the size of words in bytes for the program.
      memorySize - the size of the memory in words for the program.

  • Method Details

    • resetMemory

      public void resetMemory()
      Resets the contents of memory and registers.

    • resetAll

      public void resetAll()
      Resets the contents of memory and registers as well as stored lines and labels.

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      Return true if the program has run off of the end of the code as in program completion, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the program has run off of the end of the code as in program completion, false otherwise.

    • isErrored

      public boolean isErrored()
      Return true if the program counter is in an error state, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the program counter is in an error state, false otherwise.

    • readLine

      public Line readLine(String line) throws ParseException
      Parses the given line and returns it. Adds the line to the program as well.
      Parameters:
      line - the line of text to parse.
      Returns:
      the generated line.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error parsing the line.

    • readMultiLineString

      public void readMultiLineString(String content) throws ParseException
      Parses the given text as a multi-line String. Then adds those lines to the program.
      Parameters:
      content - the multi-line string to parse.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there was an error in parsing any line.

    • executeLine

      public void executeLine(Line line) throws ParseException
      Executes the given line on the simulator.
      Parameters:
      line - the line to execute.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error executing the line.

    • executeLine

      public void executeLine(String line) throws ParseException
      Executes the given line on the simulator.
      Parameters:
      line - the text representation of the line to execute.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error parsing or executing the line.

    • runLinesFromPC

      public void runLinesFromPC(AtomicBoolean paused) throws ParseException
      Runs the program to completion or error state from the current state of the PC. Allows for pausing of execution with the paused variable.
      Parameters:
      paused - an AtomicBoolean which allows for control over whether the execution of this is paused.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error executing any line.

    • runLinesFromPC

      public void runLinesFromPC() throws ParseException
      Runs the program to completion or error state from the current state of the PC.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error executing any line.

    • runOneLine

      public void runOneLine() throws ParseException
      Runs a single line of code from the current PC.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error executing the line.

    • getRegister

      public Register getRegister(int register)
      Gets the register of the given register reference.
      Parameters:
      register - the register's reference number.
      Returns:
      the register object corresponding to the register reference number.

      public Register getRegister(String register)
      Gets the register of the given name.
